decks.notes: This combo deck aims to efficiently ramp up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Crumbling Vestige to eventually play Lotus Field. Once Lotus Field is in play, the deck can produce a large amount of mana to cast powerful spells like Scapeshift to quickly win the game. The deck also utilizes cards like Thassa's Oracle and Stock Up for card advantage and to ensure a game-winning combo. The key strategy is to set up the board to maximize mana production and then execute a game-ending combo to secure victory.

This aggressive Selesnya deck focuses on playing creatures quickly and efficiently through ramp spells like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, allowing you to overwhelm your opponent with a steady stream of threats. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben disrupts your opponent's plans, while Archon of Emeria slows down their spellcasting. Skyclave Apparition and Collected Company provide removal and card advantage, while Badgermole Cub and Aven Interrupter offer additional threats. The deck aims to maintain pressure on your opponent while disrupting their game plan, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of synergy and aggression.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, aiming to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The deck focuses on utilizing cheap spells and creatures with prowess abilities to boost their power and take advantage of the opponent's lack of blockers. Additionally, the inclusion of bounce effects and card draw allows for flexibility and card advantage, while the mana base provides consistency in casting spells and maintaining pressure on the opponent.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on applying early pressure with cheap and aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, supported by burn spells like Reckless Rage and Fiery Impulse to control the board. The deck also utilizes card draw and filtering with cards like Experimental Synthesizer and Stormchaser's Talent to maintain momentum. The key strategy is to quickly build a wide board presence and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The deck aims to win through fast and efficient aggression while maintaining some level of card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly casting spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability and bring it back from the graveyard, allowing for fast and aggressive plays to overwhelm the opponent. It also includes cards to control the board and draw additional cards to maintain momentum. The combination of low cost spells, card draw, and graveyard recursion forms the core strategy of this aggressive deck, aiming to close out games swiftly with high damage output from the Arclight Phoenix.

This Esper Control deck focuses on utilizing the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad to maximize value from its cards. The deck includes a mix of removal spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, along with bounce spells like Boomerang Basics and Stormchaser's Talent to control the board. It also features card draw and protection with Hopeless Nightmare and Nurturing Pixie, while finishing the game with powerful creatures like Sunpearl Kirin and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through its control elements and versatile card choices.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of low-cost creatures and direct damage spells to quickly overwhelm opponents and deal fast damage. By efficiently deploying aggressive creatures like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger, supported by spells like Fiery Impulse and Stormchaser's Talent, the goal is to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics allows for additional flexibility and disruption, adding an element of control to the fast-paced strategy.

The main strategy of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of cheap, efficient creatures and burn spells. By playing aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, along with spells like Monstrous Rage and Reckless Rage, the deck seeks to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Stormchaser's Talent further supports this aggressive playstyle. Overall, the deck aims to win the game as swiftly as possible by putting pressure on the opponent and controlling the board with burn spells.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on using cheap spells and creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By playing aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, along with burn spells like Fiery Impulse, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Academic Dispute and Stormchaser's Talent provide additional card advantage and versatility. Utilizing a mix of creatures and spells, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish the game before the opponent has a chance to mount a defense.

This deck focuses on aggressive, fast-paced gameplay using cheap spells and creatures to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, and Emberheart Challenger to quickly build pressure on the opponent, while using spells like Reckless Rage and Stormchaser's Talent to remove threats and push damage through. The deck also includes cards like Academic Dispute and Experimental Synthesizer to draw cards and maintain card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of creatures and spells to secure victory.

The deck focuses on assembling the Greasefang Parhelion combo as quickly as possible using cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Bloodtithe Harvester. It also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse to protect the combo. The deck also includes additional threats like Overlord of the Balemurk and Skysovereign, Consul Flagship to apply pressure on the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while providing consistency in casting its spells.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenixes from the graveyard. It utilizes a mix of cheap spells and cantrips to trigger the Phoenix's ability, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe. The deck focuses on tempo and aggression, utilizing the Phoenix's recursive ability to close out games quickly. It also includes card draw and filtering to ensure a consistent stream of spells to keep the Phoenixes coming back.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of creatures and spells to create powerful synergies and overwhelm the opponent. By using Gran-Gran, Tinybones Joins Up, and Carnage, Crimson Chaos alongside support cards like Tainted Indulgence and Rona, Herald of Invasion, the deck aims to control the battlefield and generate card advantage. The inclusion of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push helps to disrupt the opponent's strategies. Additionally, the mana base is designed to support the deck's colors and enable efficient casting of spells. The goal is to create a formidable board presence and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of low-cost creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear to deal early damage, as well as Fiery Impulse and Experimental Synthesizer to control the board, the deck aims to establish dominance early on. The inclusion of cards like Stormchaser's Talent and Emberheart Challenger provides additional ways to go on the offensive, while cards like Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics offer disruption and card advantage. The overall strategy is to apply constant pressure and finish the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. It heavily utilizes white cards that provide specific answers to threats while also generating value through token generation and draw effects. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value by flickering creatures and permanents. The deck aims to outlast opponents by maintaining board presence and resource advantage until it can establish a dominant position and win the game.

The deck focuses on aggressively attacking the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and disruptive spells. It aims to apply pressure early in the game with cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Fear of Missing Out, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger provide additional threats and resources for the deck. The mana base is built to support the aggressive game plan, with a mix of fast lands and utility lands to ensure a consistent and efficient mana curve.
